page.title: 07Chesterfield Sewage Works
page.content: Chesterfield sewage is dealt with at the Sewage Works in Old Whittington about three miles to the north of the town. It was built in 1930 and covers two hectares of land. Twenty people are employed there and four million gallons of effluent per day are dealt with. The treated liquid waste is poured into the River Rother and the solid waste is put on tips and fields near the works. When there is an east wind blowing there is a characteristic unpleasant smell which drifts over Old Whittington especially during hot weather conditions.
